business.headline: Hyundai Motor makes weak D-Street debut. Hold for long-term gains or sell now?Hyundai Motor India stock market listing: A long-term ride to profits or time for investors to hit the brakes after its lacklustre debut?
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher led by gains in bank and IT stocks The S&P BSE Sensex gained 153.24 points to 81,304.51, while the NIfty50 added 36.80 points to 24,817.90

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Hyundai IPO set for muted stock market debut on BSE, NSEHyundai India Share Price Listing: The IPO, which opened on October 15, faced a slow start, particularly from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

Health Insurer Niva Bupa gets Sebi nod for Rs 3,000 crore IPO. Details hereThe IPO, which the company filed for back in June, will consist of a mix of Rs 800 crore in fresh shares and an offer for sale (OFS) that includes Rs 320 crore from Bupa Singapore Holdings and Rs 1,880 crore from Fettle Tone LLP.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT and metal stocks drag markets lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 73.48 points to close at 81,151.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.95 points to end at 24,781.10.

Hyundai IPO GMP improves slightly ahead of market listing. What to expect?Hyundai stock market listing: The initial public offering, which opened on October 15, has seen a rollercoaster ride in terms of investor interest and grey market performance.

Manappuram Finance shares drop 5% today, 24% in 8 days: What's behind fall?The shares of Manappuram Finance hit a low of Rs 145.50, marking a decline of nearly 24% over the past eight trading sessions.

No GST on life and health insurance? Here's how it will impact youThis change, if implemented, could bring relief to policyholders and support the insurance sector by lowering the costs of these essential services.

Tata Consumer Products shares plunge over 7% today. Here's whyTata Consumer Products share price: At 1:27 pm, the stock was trading at Rs 1015.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down by 7.2%, as investors reacted to its muted performance.

RBL Bank shares crash 15% after Q2 results: What analysts are sayingRBL Bank share price: The private lender's shares plunged in intraday trading following the release of its Q2 FY25 earnings over the weekend.

Hyundai Motor India share price expectation: Check latest gmp before D-Street debut Hyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue opened on October 15, was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, 2024, it had been subscribed more than twice.
Explained: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank shares plunged 7% after Q2 resultsAt 1:02 pm, Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were down 5.18% to Rs 1,773 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Axis Bank shares dip slightly today after strong Q2 gains. Good time to buy? Despite a strong Q2, analysts are divided on Axis Bank's future prospects. Many brokerages have adjusted their target prices, reflecting a cautious outlook on the bank's near-term growth trajectory.

Waaree Energies IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe Waaree Energies IPO consists of a fresh issue of 2.4 crore shares, amounting to Rs 3,600 crore, along with an offer for sale of 0.48 crore shares, totalling Rs 721.44 crore.

Wipro shares gain 1% in early trade. What investors need to knowThe stock's rise comes after Wipro posted better-than-expected Q2 results, including a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) increase in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore and the announcement of a 1:1 bonus issue.

Adar Poonawalla acquires 50% stake in Karan Johar's Dharma ProductionsKaran Johar's Dharma Productions sells 50% stake to Adar Poonawalla: The deal, valued at Rs 1,000 crore, will see Poonawalla's Serene Production acquire a 50% stake in the renowned production house, with Johar retaining the remaining 50%.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally lower dragged by FMCG stocks; HDFC Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 70.87 points to 81,153.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 58.90 points to 24,795.15

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Won't apologise, Sanatana remarks misinterpreted, says Udhayanidhi StalinUdhayanidhi Stalin refused to apologise for 'Sanatana Dharma' remarks, stating that the comments targeted its alleged repressive practices towards women.

Why Ajit Pawar's NCP is BJP-Sena Mahayuti's weakest linkAs the Mahayuti of the BJP, Shiv Sena and the NCP combine their forces for the Maharashtra election, the Ajit Pawar-led party is being seen as its weakest link. From Pawar's graft-tainted image to the NCP's failure of getting votes transferred, several factors make it the faltering wheel of a three-wheeled autorickshaw.
Israel claims it found $500 million in gold, cash in Hassan Nasrallah's bunkerThe IDF said that it was monitoring the bunker but had no plans to strike it as it was constructed under a hospital.

Pak-based new terror outfit dismantled in J&K's Poonch in major operationCounter-Intelligence Kashmir (CIK) conducted a major operation in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, carrying out raids across multiple districts including Srinagar, Ganderbal, Bandipora, Kulgam, Budgam, Anantnag, and Pulwama.

PM Modi leaves for Russia to attend Brics Summit, will meet Putin today Live UpdatesBesides Russia's Vladimir Putin, the Prime Minister is likely to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping, as well as hold bilateral talks with leaders from the other Brics member nations.

Punjab gives nod to prosecute Dera chief Ram Rahim in sacrilege casesThe development comes three days after the Supreme Court lifted the stay imposed by the Punjab and Haryana High Court on the trial against Ram Rahim Singh in the 2015 sacrilege cases.

Why do planes dump fuel during emergency landings, and where does it go?While fuel dumping may seem counterintuitive, especially given current fuel prices, it remains a crucial safety measure in aviation.

Can India trust China amid talks over disengagement along LAC? What experts sayExperts suggest that while this is a significant step in diffusing tensions between the two countries, India should be cautious about China's motives.

Liam Payne had 'pink cocaine' in his system at time of death: Toxicology reportPost-mortem results indicated that Liam Payne was alone at the time of the fall and "was going through an episode of substance abuse", according to prosecutors.

Jagmeet Singh pushes for India-Canada committee amid diplomatic row, turned downJagmeet Singh claimed that Canada's democracy was under threat and blamed the Conservative Party for blocking the move to create an India-Canada committee.

Viral: Bengaluru auto driver's 'genius' idea to teach Kannada during rideA Bengaluru auto driver, Ajmal Sultan, has gone viral for teaching basic Kannada through a poster inside his vehicle. Passengers can learn common phrases, like greetings and payment questions, while they ride.
Delhi man finds 'centipede' in meal at VIP Railway lounge, recounts horrorA Delhi man shared a photograph of a live centipede that he found in his meal at IRCTC's VIP Executive Lounge.

Why the TMC is so serious about Bijoya Sammelani events this yearFacing protests over the R.G. Kar rape and murder, Bengal's ruling party is using the traditional get-togethers as a platform of outreach for damage control ahead of bypolls for six seats

Row over IAS officer's remark on temple loudspeakers, Hindu outfit protestsThe Madhya Pradesh IAS officer made the remark amid a debate on social media following the death of a 13-year-old boy while he was dancing to DJ music last week.

Iceland, Finland, Russia: Why the best time to see the Northern Lights is NOWNASA just announced that the sun has reached its solar maximum, which means that the year from now is the best in a decade to see the Northern Lights.

Woman who survived October 7 Hamas attack dies by suicide on 22nd birthdayShirel Golan survived the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack at the Supernova music festival in Israel. She was found dead at her home on her 22nd birthday.

US not looking at Brics as geopolitical rival, says White House ahead of summitThe White House Press Secretary's remarks came ahead of the two-day 16th Brics Summit slated to begin in Russia's Kazan city on Tuesday.

Babita Phogat planned wrestlers' protest to become federation chief: Sakshi MalikWrestler Sakshi Malik has claimed that BJP leader Babita Phogat encouraged the wrestlers' protest against Brij Bhushan Singh, alleging Phogat sought to become the president of the Wrestling Federation of India.

Watch: Annoyed Abhishek Bachchan tells paparazzi 'bas ho gaya' at Mumbai airportActor Abhishek Bachchan was seen at the Mumbai airport on Monday. He folded his hands and asked the paparazzi to stop filming him, before walking away with his friend, producer Bunty Walia.

Cyclone Dana to hit Odisha, Bengal in 48 hours, schools shut, evacuations onCyclone Dana will likely cause extremely heavy rainfall in Odisha and West Bengal on October 24 and 25, and heavy rainfall in both states till Friday, the weather body said.

Delhi air quality remains 'very poor', anti-pollution restrictions imposedDelhi's air quality is expected to deteriorate further, with the AQI likely to exceed 400 and fall into the 'severe' category on Tuesday and Wednesday, due to stubble burning in neighbouring states and unfavourable wind conditions.

Jay Shah's entry to alter ICC rules? Board recommends changesThe International Cricket Council has recommended changes in the chief's tenure. The move comes right before Jay Shah is set to take over the cricket body.

Kerala MLA Ramesh Chennithala meets Suriya, praises Jai BhimKerala MLA Ramesh Chennithala met actor Suriya at the Delhi airport. He praised Suriya's Jai Bhim and called him a person who is aware of his social responsibilities.

Mika Singh shows support for Salman Khan amid death threats: I'm here for youSinger Mika Singh expressed support for Salman Khan during a concert amid threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. Salman now has heightened security following recent threats.

GST relief for film industry for 2017 to 2021: What it means for distributorsThe Ministry of Finance gave clarity on the Goods and Services Tax (GST) applicable to film distribution for the period June 2017 to October 2021. The ministry revised GST rates from 12 per cent to 18 per cent in 2021.

Actor Drashti Dhami channels her inner Rachel Green in new pregnancy postTV actor Drashti Dhami shared a video from her pregnancy journey. In the post, she jokingly channeled her inner Rachel Green, expressing frustration about her baby not arriving yet.

Prithvi Shaw reacts after getting dropped from Ranji Trophy squadMumbai batter Prithvi Shaw has been dropped from the Mumbai team from Round 3 of the Ranji Trophy. Shaw has reportedly been dropped due to disciplinary issues.

Polly Inglis earns maiden call-up as New Zealand women name squad for India ODIsPolly Inglis has been named in the New Zealand Women's squad for their India tour, marking her debut in a 15-member squad. The series serves as vital preparation for the upcoming ODI World Cup.

MI, KKR amongst five IPL franchises bidding for teams in The Hundred: ReportSeveral IPL franchises, including Mumbai Indians and Kolkata Knight Riders, have shown interest in acquiring teams in The Hundred, a tournament run by the ECB. The bidding process aims to finalise investors by 2025, with a potential hybrid ownership model being considered.

Smith out for 0, Marnus bowls medium pace as AUS prep for India TestsSenior Australia batter continued to have poor fortunes in Sheffield Shield in the build-up to the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Batting against Victoria Smith scored 3 and 0 in two innings. On the other hand, Marnus Labuschagne was spotted bowling medium-pace.

Clement Lenglet joins Atletico Madrid injury list ahead of Lille tieAtletico Madrid faces a major setback as Clément Lenglet joins the injury list ahead of their Champions League match against Lille. With key players already out, Simeone's squad faces a tough challenge.

Michael Clarke backs Bancroft to open for Australia in Test series vs IndiaFormer Australian captain Michael Clarke backs Cameron Bancroft's return to the Test team, advocating for his selection as an opener against India. Clarke highlights Bancroft's consistent domestic performance as a key factor.

Used to travel in trains by the toilets: Sakshi Malik on career strugglesIn an interview with India Today, firmer India wrestler Sakshi Malik discussed her early struggles as a wrestler, including travelling by train next to toilets. She also shared insights from her autobiography Witness and her experience in the wrestlers' protest.

Sarfaraz Khan welcomes baby boy a day after Bengaluru Test heroicsSarfaraz Khan announced the birth of his baby boy just a day after his impressive 150-run performance in India's Bengaluru Test against New Zealand. He shared the first picture of his newborn on Instagram, alongside his father Naushad Khan.
IND vs NZ: Team India gets rousing reception in Pune ahead of 2nd TestIndian Cricket Team arrived in Pune amid loud cheers ahead of the second Test against New Zealand set to begin from October 24.

Ruturaj Gaikwad to lead India A on Australia tour, Ishan Kishan named wicketkeeperThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) named a 15-member India A squad for the Australia tour on Monday, October 21 announcing Ruturaj Gaikwad as captain.

WI vs ENG: Salt and Pepper to open for England? Selection news thrills fansEngland are likely to open with a new batting pair of Philip Salt and Michael Pepper in the ODI series on the tour to West Indies.

Abhishek Sharma shines in India A's thumping win over UAEIndia A secured a convincing victory over UAE, led by Abhishek Sharma's all-round brilliance, jumping to the top of Group B in the Emerging Asia Cup with two wins from two matches.

Mohammed Shami reveals IPL captaincy ambition ahead of mega auctionMohammed Shami, currently recovering from ankle surgery, expressed openness to captaining an IPL franchise. As speculation swirls about his future with Gujarat Titans, Shami remains focused on returning to full fitness for upcoming cricket challenges.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
